articles.author: HELENA ALVES and JOSEPH WILSON
articles.title: Wildfires scorch parts of Europe amid extreme heat wave
articles.description: LISBON, Portugal (AP) — A spate of wildfires is scorching parts of Europe, with firefighters battling blazes in Portugal, Spain and southern France on Wednesday amid an unusual heat wave that authorities are linking to climate change.

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER RUGABER
articles.title: US inflation surges again in June, raising risks for economy
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — U.S. inflation surged to a new four-decade high in June because of rising prices for gas, food and rent, squeezing household budgets and pressuring the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates aggressively -- trends that raise the risk of a recession.

articles.author: JOSH BOAK, JOSEF FEDERMAN and AAMER MADHANI
articles.title: In Mideast, Biden cites 'bone deep' bond between US, Israel
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Joe Biden opened his first visit to the Mideast as president on Wednesday by declaring a “bone deep” bond between the United States and Israel and pledging to strengthen economic connections between the two countries going forward.

articles.author: KRISHAN FRANCIS and KRUTIKA PATHI
articles.title: Sri Lanka in crisis: President flees and ire turns to PM
articles.description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Sri Lanka’s president fled the country Wednesday, plunging a nation already reeling from economic chaos into more political turmoil.

articles.author: LISA MASCARO and FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.title: Jan. 6 probe: Trump sets rally after 'unhinged' WH meeting
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In a heated, “unhinged” dispute, Donald Trump fought objections from his White House lawyers to a plan, eventually discarded, to seize states' voting machines and then, in a last ditch effort to salvage his presidency, summoned supporters to march on the U.S.

articles.author: OLEKSANDR STASHEVSKYI, HANNA ARHIROVA and MARIA GRAZIA MURRU
articles.title: Minister: Ukraine needs assurances to resume grain exports
articles.description: Kyiv, Ukraine (AP) — The Ukrainian foreign minister says grain exports from his country's ports won't resume without security guarantees for ship owners, cargo owners and Ukraine as an independent nation.

articles.author: ACACIA CORONADO and PAUL J. WEBER
articles.title: Uvalde's new anguish: Video shows police waiting in school
articles.description: UVALDE, Texas (AP) — A new wave of anger swept through Uvalde on Tuesday over surveillance footage of police officers in body armor milling in the hallway of Robb Elementary School while a gunman carried out a massacre inside a fourth-grade classroom where 19 children and two teachers were killed.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: EXPLAINER: What's the impact of euro parity with the dollar?
articles.description: The euro is hovering close to parity with the dollar, falling to its lowest level in 20 years and even briefly touching a one-to-one exchange rate with the U.S.

articles.author: AMANDA SEITZ
articles.title: LGBTQ harassment, slurs abound on social media, report says
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Social media platforms including Facebook and TikTok are failing to stop hate and threats against LGBTQ users, a report issued Wednesday from advocacy group GLAAD found.

articles.title: Cost-of-living crisis to hit women hardest, report says
articles.description: GENEVA (AP) — A cost-of-living crisis sparked in part by higher fuel and food prices is expected to hit women the hardest, the World Economic Forum reported Wednesday, pointing to a widening gender gap in the global labor force.
